comment.author: 50889628@N08
comment._content: ”...until a pier was built on Inisheer (Inis Oírr) in 1997.”  That seems so late to me! But perhaps there were economic and physical reasons.

comment.author: 57577298@N02
comment._content: Good picture, Charles Darwin sighted in Chiloe, Chile Southamerica, how transport the islanders a cow on the light boat across the lake in Cucao, they attached a wood in its legs, and place down 180° inside the boat, in 1836.

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/plaisanter] Well, I think building something in the sea (Atlantic) is physically challenging - cold, tides, wild weather, etc. But I'm sure there were economic reasons also. Inisheer is the smallest of the Aran Islands. And I think the pier on Inishbofin wasn't built until late 1980s/early 1990s either...
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment._content: I know this remark will be seen as my being a whimp but the look of fear on that animals face I found to be quite heart rending.
